dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Unstable weather across most of Kazakhstan this weekend, starting April 26th.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unstable weather across most of Kazakhstan this weekend, starting April twenty sixth.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Meteorologists have issued a weather forecast for Kazakhstan for April 26, 27, and 28. According to the forecast, unstable weather is expected across most of Kazakhstan due to passing atmospheric fronts, bringing rain, thunderstorms, strong winds, and possibly hail.

dialogue_turns.text: They mentioned heavy rains in some parts, and also fog in the western, eastern, and southeastern regions.

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Heavy rains are forecast for: Fog is expected in the western, eastern, and southeastern parts of the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and get this—frost is expected at night, like minus one to minus three degrees in the Abai Region.

dialogue_turns.text: For sure. You'd think it'd be warming up by now, but I guess not.

dialogue_turns.text: Makes you wonder how farmers and folks in those regions are preparing, you know?

dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And travelers should probably keep an eye on road conditions with all that rain and fog.

dialogue_turns.text: So if you're in Kazakhstan this weekend, maybe just… stay indoors if you can.
